fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User not able to add a comment in attachment when using *drag this pin to add a comment* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a pdf file in a page
 # Go to the view attachment page
 # Click view and *drag this pin to add a comment* 


h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to add a comment.

h3. Actual Results
The comment box keep spinning
 !Capture.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Drag this pin to add a comment is not working in attachment

fields.description: If the admins need to receive notifications of all changes to pages for monitoring purpose, they will not able to do so if the users use "publish without notifying watchers". The ability to restrict this feature is required.
fields.summary: The ability to disable "publish without notifying watchers" button

fields.description:
*Description:-*

In Confluence Cloud we have the option of searching the spaces based on various criteria. The below filter buttons are currently available for search.

a) All b) Watching c) Starred d)Communal e)Personal f) Archived. In addition, you can search by entering the Space name title in the text field.

When the All button is selected it shows all spaces except for Archived. However, there is no visual indicator to show that it is excluded. Similarly, when you do a title-based search the results exclude Archived spaces.

*Steps to replicate:-*

1) Navigate to [https://xxxx.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces]
 2) Search spaces using the 'All' filter button as in Screenshot. It will list all spaces including Watching, Starred, Communal, and Personal. However, there is no indication to the user that Archived spaces are excluded.
 3) Search spaces by entering the Title in the text field. Here also Archived spaces are excluded but there is no visual indication.

*Suggested resolution:-*

Provide a visual indicator that Archived spaces are not available in search using the 'All' filter button and 'Filter by Title' text field.
fields.summary: Visual indicator to show that 'All' button filter and title based space search in Confluence do not include Archived spaces.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 We noticed that when you are viewing attachment analytics it displays how many users viewed that attachment, however, it doesn't have an option to click the views to determine what user viewed the attachment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Space analytics
 # Click pages
 # Select a page with attachments
 # Click on attachments
 # Notice it displayed the number of viewers
 # This number should be clickable and show what users viewed the attachment.

h3. Expected Results

We want this to show what users viewed a specific attachment
h3. Actual Results

Currently, the amount of viewers is not clickable and won't display that wanted information.
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Allow attachment analytics to display what users viewed the attachment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the link is used to comment inline, hovering the mouse to it obscure the URL address like in the screenshot below:

This becomes a challenge for the users who are simply hovering a mouse to see the URL from a display text.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table and add a link inside the table
 # Add a display text or simply just let it be.
 !image-2021-04-23-00-53-53-728.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2 (1).png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
Hovering the mouse to inline comment should not obscure the link

h3. Actual Results
It makes the link unclear or shows half of it or Obscured.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inline Comment when done on a link, it makes the link unclear/obscure.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you add the Jira macro to a Confluence page, it does not show the total number of issues when your preferred language is Portuguese (both from Brazil and Portugal).

You will see the following error message:
{code:java}
jiraissues.static.issues.word
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your preferred language to Portuguese under [account preferences|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences].
 # Create a page in Confluence.
 # Add the Jira issue macro.
# Choose a JQL that will display more than one issue.

h3. Expected Results

The Jira macro should display the total number of issues.
h3. Actual Results

The total number of issues doesn't show up, but the following error message:
{code:java}
jiraissues.static.issues.word
{code}
h3. Workaround

* Change the preferred language to another one.
* Tap the link that should be displaying the total number of issues so the issues can be viewed directly from Jira.
fields.summary: Jira issue macro doesn't display the total number of issues when Confluence is in Portuguese

fields.description: It would be useful to have an option to add the metadata from exports, such as the PDF or word, to include information such as the creator, author among other info.
fields.summary: Include option on PDF/word exports to  include file metadata

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Task Report macro is currently duplicating some tasks depending on how its pagination is set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page called _Tasks Page_ and add around 50 tasks;
# Add a label to this page ({{abcd}}, for example);
# Create a new page called _Task Report_ and add the Task Report macro;
# Configure this macro to get pages with the label {{abcd}}
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The _Task Report_ page shows all the expected tasks with correct pagination for the exceeding tasks.

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes, the pagination causes the tasks to get duplicated in the Task Report macro.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Task Report macro duplicates tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's impossible to edit PDF files using Atlassian Companion app on macOS Big Sur (macOS 11). I confirmed it works as expected in Catalina (macOS 10.15). 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Atlassian Companion (current version 1.2.5) on macOS Big Sur.
 # Attach a PDF file to a page. Preview the PDF or view the Attachments list, click *Edit file/Edit with*. 
 # The PDF file does not open. Only PDFs are affected.
 # Other file types open correctly, such as DOCX and XLSX.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should suggest an app to edit the PDF and open it in that app.
h3. Actual Results

The Atlassian Companion app does not open the PDF in Preview. It either asks to install *Atlassian Companion* or gets stuck loading.

!CleanShot 2021-04-29 at 15.26.19@2x.png|width=199,height=175,thumbnail!   !image-2021-04-29-15-50-11-520.png|width=238,height=171,thumbnail!

The below exception is in the companion.log file:
{noformat}
error:	adc:browser 2021-04-01T15:05:39.018Z logged raw sentry error: {"extra":{"unhandledPromiseRejection":true,"Error":{"errno":-2,"syscall":"open","code":"ENOENT","path":"/System/Applications/Books.app/Contents/Resources/undefined.icns"},"node":"v12.13.0"},"message":"Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/System/Applications/Books.app/Contents/Resources/undefined.icns'","exception":[{"type":"Error","value":"ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/System/Applications/Books.app/Contents/Resources/undefined.icns'","stacktrace":{"frames":
{noformat}
h4. Notes

The Companion app refers to the default PDF app in macOS to annotate PDF documents. In some cases, the default is *Books*. When opening a PDF in *Books* on macOS, it will redirect to *Preview* to display the PDF.

According to these Apple Developer forum threads, there is an issue with the *Books* app serving PDF files.
 * [Books app crashing after macOS Catalina 10.15 beta 6 update|https://developer.apple.com/forums/thread/121533]
 * [Books on MacOS Big Sur not showing my PDFs|https://developer.apple.com/forums/thread/659317]

h3. Workaround

First, ensure *Books* isn't the default PDF app. To change your default PDF app to *Preview*_,_ right-click the downloaded PDF file, select *Open with...*, and down at the bottom, select *Other...* Choose *Preview* in Applications, and make sure to check "Always Open With."

!CleanShot 2021-04-29 at 15.43.59@2x.png|thumbnail!   !CleanShot 2021-04-29 at 16.04.31@2x.png|thumbnail!

If you still encounter the issue with *Preview* on Big Sur, there is no workaround for editing PDFs in the Companion app. Preview is my default in my test case, but the error in the Companion app logs still mentions *Books*.
fields.summary: Unable to edit PDF on Big Sur in using Companion App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we have a roadmap planner macro and we try to link a page that has a line break/ new line character on its title, the macro will break, causing the page to not be viewable/ editable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page A that contains a line break on its title 
The line break can be added either through copy+paste or by using the REST API
# Create page B with a roadmap planner on it
# Try to link page A on any of the roadmap's bars

h3. Expected Results
The page should be linkable without problems

h3. Actual Results
* Upon linking the page, it will display as broken macro:
|  !broken_roadmap.png|thumbnail!  |
* The page won't render on view mode with the following error:
|  !view_mode.png|thumbnail! |
{code:none}We couldn't display your content

Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support.{code}
* And the page can't be edited with this error:
|  !edit_mode.png|thumbnail! |
{code:none}We couldn't load the editor.
Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support.{code}
* The below exception is thrown in the browser's console:
{code:none}Invalid adf document SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0
    at Object.parse (<anonymous>)
    at ContentRenderer.tsx:31
    at ContentRenderer.tsx:100
    at Ji (react-dom.production.min.js:153)
    at Bs (react-dom.production.min.js:175)
    at Fs (react-dom.production.min.js:175)
    at xa (react-dom.production.min.js:268)
    at mu (react-dom.production.min.js:246)
    at vu (react-dom.production.min.js:246)
    at au (react-dom.production.min.js:239){code}

h3. Workaround
Contact us through https://support.atlassian.com/ mentioning this bug and a link to the affected page so we can remove the broken link for you.
(i) For support engineers: check the first internal comment for instructions.
fields.summary: Linking certain pages on the roadmap planner macro will break the macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*Scenario:*
 The user has configured under [profile and visibility|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility] that only people in their organization can see their Full Name. In that case, anyone who's outside their organization will see their Public Name.

In Jira, users from the same organization will see the users' names as their full names. However, when adding the Jira macro to a Confluence page, the public name of that user will be shown.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test user and add them to your organization.
 # Under profile and visibility, make their Full Name restricted to people from their organization.
 # Give a Public Name different from the Full Name.
 # Give the test user access to Jira and assign them to an issue.
 # On Confluence, create a page.
 # Add the Jira macro and make it display the issue from Jira.

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to see the Full name of the user on the Confluence page as well.
h3. Actual Results

In Jira, we see the user's Full Name, in Confluence we see their Public Name.
 The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
h3. Workaround

If possible, ask the users' to have the name Public Name and Full Name.
fields.summary: Jira macro displays the public name of users instead of their full name for people from their organization

fields.description: Currently, when the default language is changed in the administration of code macros, from Java to C ++ for example, a record of this change in the audit record is not created and it would be better if it could be recorded to track when these changes are done.
fields.summary: Register an Audit Log when the Language is Changed on Code Macro Administration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copying a page and selecting "no parent", the page fails to copy with graphQL errors:

!Screen Shot 2021-04-21 at 11.13.02 AM.png|width=507,height=214!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the ... menu to select copy
 # Select a space to copy to and change the Parent page drop down to "No parent" if it's not already selected

h3. Expected Results

Page copies correctly
h3. Actual Results

Copy page dialog shows "Something went wrong. Please try again later"
h3. Workaround

Select a parent in the parent page drop down to work around this issue

 

Notes:

This only seems to happen when copying into "Imported spaces" with "No parent" selected.
fields.summary: Copy page fails when no parent is selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ability to generate a report to view all of the un-converted/non-migrated pages (old editor pages)
h3. Description

It would be nice to have the possibility to let our customers generate a report so they can view all the un-converted/non-migrated pages that are still using the old editor. 
This feature could be very useful for many different use cases.
fields.summary: Ability to generate a report to view all of the un-converted pages (old editor pages)
Unable to import Word file with "Shapes" inserted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Location of Comments is wrong in legacy editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce

    # Create a page in legacy editor
    # Add different headings and table of contents on the top
    # Publish the page
    # Add a comment y selecting any header text on the page. 
    # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
 the comment should appears against the text in the header
h3. Actual Results
the comment appears against the text IN THE Table of Contents macro, and not the header text (in the page).

h3. Workaround

Currently, the workaround is to convert the page to the new editor.
fields.summary: Location of Comments is wrong in legacy editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trying to add/ edit certain macros will result in an infinite spinner.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit any page or create a new one
# Try to add or edit the following macros:
** Task report
** Blog posts

h3. Expected Results
It should load the macro preview and settings

h3. Actual Results
The macro preview and settings will spin forever
| !Screen Shot 2021-04-20 at 9.29.07 PM.png|thumbnail! |
The following error is thrown at the browser's console:
{code:none}com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:15 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'split' of undefined
    at Object.b.multiple.a.setValue (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:15)
    at a (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:81)
    at Object.<anonymous> (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:81)
    at Function.each (jquery.js:671)
    at init.each (jquery.js:280)
    at Object.loadMacroInBrowser (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:81)
    at Object.successCallback [as success] (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:126)
    at p (jquery.js:1086)
    at Object.fireWith [as resolveWith] (jquery.js:1204)
    at w (jquery.js:7565){code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Specific macros can't be added or edited

fields.description:
The Office Excel Macro has some different functionalities between server and cloud, we wish to improve the experience of this macro on cloud to something similar to what it is on server, where it has some parameters are used to change the behavior of the excel macro.

These parameters below are only available on the server macro and it would be good to have them on confluence as well.

* Show Grid?
* Worksheet Name
* Last Row
* Last Column
fields.summary: Add Parameters on Office Excel Macro

fields.description:
The attachments macro in Confluence can be used to show all attachments that are included on the page I am working on.

I would like to have the feature to extend this macro so that it is possible to show all attachments on the corresponding page including its child pages. Furthermore it would be great to use this macro for the whole space.
fields.summary: Extend attachements macro in order to include child pages
Improve API to get Space permissions

fields.description:
h3. Background

Currently, when the admin installing a third-party plugin a *plugin user* account will be added to all the spaces.

It will be good to make changes in authorizations explicit, and only add new third-party user accounts after asking explicit consent from the Admin.
fields.summary: Option to add Third party app user after approval by admin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a general page that should be 100% high, it renders with slightly larger height causing a scroll bar to appear. 

For additional context, see https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/generalpage-doesnt-get-proper-height-in-chrome/46688.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app declaring a general page such that it should be full height. See [https://glitch.com/edit/#!/dx-general-page-app?path=page.html%3A51%3A0] and [https://dx-general-page-app.glitch.me/connect.json].
 # Install the app.
 # Visit the general page created by the app.
 # Observe the rendered results.

h3. Expected Results

The height of the general page is such that it fills the page space provided, but no more.
h3. Actual Results

An additional scroll bar appears. The following fixes it:
{noformat}
const scrollHeight = document.body.scrollHeight;
AP.resize('100%', `${scrollHeight.toString()}px`);
AP.sizeToParent();
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Full height general page not sized correctly

fields.description:
By observation, a dynamic content macro editor will open by default only if one input parameter is declared with the required property set to true. This is not explained in the documentation.

Macro input parameters seem to only relate to standard dynamic content macro editors, but it seems that a mandatory macro input parameter is required if a custom editor should be opened by default. The documentation should clarify if/when macro input parameters need to be specified when a custom editor is defined.

Some apps in the Atlassian Marketplace have dynamic content macros which open full screen editors. It would be great to see example code explaining how to do this.

See also:

* [https://glitch.com/edit/#!/dx-full-page-macro-editor-app]

* [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/confluence-dynamiccontentmacro-is-it-possible-to-open-custom-editor-upon-macro-add/47208]

* [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/savemacro-without-custom-editor/46283]
fields.summary: Improvements to dynamic content macro documentation

fields.description: Create some functionality that allows the user to generate a report that lists all spaces that are using the team calendars plug-in and their last activity like the last person to modify it and the date that was changed.
fields.summary: Report Team Calendars Activity

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When search count is enabled on the analytics overview tab is displaying view count metric instead of search metric
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Apps -> Analytics
 # Enable Searches

h3. Expected Results

Orange sparkline for searches should dispaly search count
h3. Actual Results

Sparkline is displaying the view count metric instead of search count metric
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Analytics Search counts by date is not correct

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding the [Children DIsplay Macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-children-display-macro/] to a page and configuring it to "Include Excerpts" with the *Rich content* parameter, the following error will be displayed if the child pages contain a [Table of contents macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-table-of-contents-macro/] or the[Change history Macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-change-history-macro/]:

{code}
Error rendering macro 'children' : [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] Undeclared namespace prefix "ac" (for attribute "local-id") at [row,col \{unknown-source} ]: [1,1111]
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and include the *Children display* macro. While configuring its parameters, under the *Excerpt Display* configuration, select *Rich content*
# Create at least one child page and add either the [Table of contents macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-table-of-contents-macro/], Children Display (with content populating child pages) or the [Change history Macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-change-history-macro/]
child pages with TOC macro and change history macro.
# Go back to the parent page including the *Children Display* macro

h3.  Expected Results

The parent page with the Children macro should display the Excerpt content of child pages.

h3. Actual Results

The Children Display Macro displays the following error:

{code}
"Error rendering macro 'children' : [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] Undeclared namespace prefix "ac" (for attribute "local-id") at [row,col \{unknown-source}

]: [1,111]"
{code}
h3. Workaround

There are different workarounds to be implemented for this one:

* Change the *Excerpt Display* parameter of the Children Display macro to *none* or *simple*.
* Remove the *Table of Contents*, *Change Change History*, or the *Children Display* macros from the child pages.
* Contact Atlassian support for the removal of the attribute in the macros added for the child pages.
fields.summary: Children Display Macro gives an error Undeclared namespace prefix "ac" (for attribute "local-id")

fields.description:
Allow further customization of the "Code" macro in the new editor. The "Code" macro replaced "Code Block" macro, but it does not allow as many customization options as the macro it replaced.

Current Situation
Currently, the "Code" macro replaced the "Code Block" macro in the new editor, but this new macro won't provide users with much customization options (just its width) as much as the old macro did. This includes:

Change the background color (theme)
Collapse
fields.summary: Allow further customization of the "Code" macro in the new editor (Different background color & ability to collapse the code block)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team Calendars has become a feature part of Confluence Cloud Premium and is no longer an add-on. However, some customers have reported that the team calendars app is still showing up under *Manage Apps > User-installed apps*. Moreover, they see a *Free Trial* button right next to it, even though calendars are already being used in the instance.

Team Calendars shouldn't appear under Manage Apps, it should be a system app.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you are on a Premium instance.
 # Go to Apps > Manage Apps > User-installed apps

h3. Expected Results
Team Calendars shouldn't appear as an add-on but as a system app.
h3. Actual Results

Team calendars appears under Manage Apps:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-16 at 15.52.53.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team Calendars app is still appearing under user-installed apps for Premium customers

fields.description:
Currently on Confluence Cloud, it is possible to [export files to word or PDF|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml/].

However, it is only possible to export PDF by exporting on each page one at time or do a full export of the space.

It would be useful to have an option to bulk export pages, so each page will be on a separated PDF.
fields.summary: Additional Option to PDF Exports

fields.description: As a user, I want to be able to add a custom button to the top navigation bar in confluence. Upon clicking the button, it should redirect a specific link.
fields.summary: Ability to add a custom button to confluence top navigation menu-bar

fields.description:
At the moment the Page History shows a list of all the versions, but the option to Delete a version is only available for previous versions of the page. There is no way to delete the current version. The only option is to restore a previous version, which makes a copy of that version as the new Current version.

This all seems like a "silly and unnecessary dance" which causes user frustration, and it adds an extra page history item (which seems like more "bloat").

If the user has Page Delete permissions, why not let them just delete the Current version, thus making the most recent previous version the Current one again?

This is particularly handy if the user realizes that they made an edit and just want to revert it again.

It should be obvious that page deletion requires appropriate user permissions. This request doesn't change that, and an ordinary user without permissions wouldn't be able to do this.

 

Steps to replicate:
 # Create a page and make multiple published edits e.g. to give it 3 versions
 # Go to More actions (...), then Page History
 # Look at the links in the Action column on the right side of the history (next to the versions) - there is no link for Delete in the row for the Current version.

 

If there is a VALID underlying technical reason why this isn't possible (maybe it's got something to do with the way rendered pages are cached or handled when multiple users are viewing them simultaneously), then please share that !  However, if this is true, then please explain this limitation in the Confluence Cloud documentation (rather than leaving everyone guessing!)
fields.summary: It should be possible to delete the current version of a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you press enter or tab at the page title, instead of moving to the next line the cursor goes to the last part of the page that you clicked.

so for example, if you are editing the bottom of the page then go to the page title. and click on it and press enter it will go back to the bottom of the page instead of creating a new line below the page title.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select some text towards the bottom of the document

 # Click the Page Title to move the selection there

 # Press Tab or Enter to move selection back to the document

h3. Expected Results
The selection moves to the start of the document
h3. Actual Results
The selection moves back to the last selection created
h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing focus from Title to Document causes unexpected selection

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A few time ago, the way that the Google Drive macros used to embed the files in our pages allowed us to either set the file width or let it in full screen.
In the published version, there was also an expand button that would allow us to expand the file to fulfill the entire page, for a better view of the document.

h3. Suggestion
* Bring back this expanding button, as due to some recent changes that were applied to the Google Drive add-on to work with smart links, this feature was removed.
fields.summary: Bring back the expand file button on Google Drive files

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Clicking in the table cell with an attachment splits up the table into two parts

h3. Steps to Reproduce

     # Create a table
    # Add an attachment to any cell
    # copy the attachment using ctrl+c
    # Paste it in any other cell using ctrl+v
    # publish the page
    #Edit the page again
    # Click on the pasted attachment 

h3. Expected Results
         It should not split the table 
h3. Actual Results

It splits the table into two parts

h3. Workaround

Currently, the workaround is to add an attachment using other methods like Drag and drop or upload instead of shortcuts like ctrl+c
fields.summary: Clicking in the table cell with an attachment splits up the table into two parts

fields.description:
Auto formatting specific strings to emoji characters is nice in an instant messaging app but not always welcome in a documentation platform like Confluence.

When creating technical documentation, for example, units are often placed in parentheses after text to indicate the units used for a value. Attempting to state that something is expressed as a percentage has us writing things like "Value Name (%)". The issue with the new editor is that *every time* the units in the above example become 😵.

Disabling all auto-formatting to get rid of this annoyance is not an ideal situation because the other shortcuts (like ## for headings etc.) are actually useful.
fields.summary: Option to disable text auto-formatting to emoji characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have a Premium/Enterprise subscription, you can create [a Sandbox|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/] based on your production tenant. On the Org administration, users are able to trigger a data copy, which should copy all data from the production tenant, to the sandbox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(on) Make sure you are an Org admin and that Confluence Cloud is on Premium/Enterprise subscription.
# Access the Org administration.
# Click on *Products*, on the top navigation bar.
# Click on *Sandbox*, on the sidebar.
# Create a Sandbox, if you don't have one.
# Trigger the data copy.

h3. Expected Results
Once the process is completed, all Spaces should be copied.

h3. Actual Results
Once the process is completed, only a few Spaces are copied, even though no error is displayed.

h3. Workaround
If you need to copy a particular Space to the Sandbox, you can still manually export it from the Production tenant, and them import it on the Sandbox one.
fields.summary: Copy data to sandbox doesn't copy all Spaces

fields.description:
As a site-admin and space administrator it is possible to remove the page restrictions for a page, even though you don't have view or edit restrictions in that page.

When going to the space settings and into the 'Restricted Pages' tab, upon clicking on the padlock in the 'Operations' column for the restricted page, we get 'No permission You don't have permission to view this page' on for each padlock clicked.

It would be useful to improve the feedback/error message or implemented an easier way to remove the restrictions on the restricted pages list.

As workaround, the user can click on the padlock icon and ask it to open on a new tab, even though the message will display on the new tabs, and then refresh the restricted pages list to see if everything was removed for that page.
fields.summary: Improve the removal of Restrictions for page in Restricted Pages list on the Space Settings

fields.description: the german translation at the general configuration site for the point "Jira Marco Reperatur" is wrong. The right spelling would be "Reparatur".
fields.summary: Typo at General Configuration Site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The _confluence-admin-<sitename>_ group doesn't appear in the 'Default Space Permissions' list. So Confluence product admins do not get added to Space permissions when new spaces are created
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a site-admin, create a new confluence space.
 # Check the confluence space permissions for the new space; the groups _site-admin, confluence-users-<sitename>_ and _administrators_ will be in the space permissions, but _confluence-admin-<sitename>_ will not
 # Go into Site admin, and invite a new user to the confluence site as a confluence product admin
 # Login as the new user and visit the newly created space
 # The new user will not have access

h3. Expected Results

The _confluence-admin-<sitename>_ should be added to the 'Default Space Permissions', and added to all new spaces, by default.
h3. Actual Results

The _confluence-admin-<sitename>_ is not in the 'Default Space Permissions', and confluence product admins do not have access to new spaces.
h3. Workaround
 # Add the _confluence-admin-<sitename>_ group to the 'Default Space Permissions' list within confluence settings, and apply the same permissions as the _administrators_ group.
 # Go into each space setting and ensure the _confluence-admin-<sitename>_ group is added with the same permissions as the _administrators_ group.
fields.summary: Users with the Confluence Admin Role do not get access to existing spaces

fields.description: there should be a way to set ourselves as away in Confluence, something like a status.
fields.summary: User profile status ( Available , away or offline )

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The user seeing page keeps spinning when they click on the keyboard page edit shortcut (e).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Paste confluence page URL on the browser
 # Immediately click on the page edit keyboard shortcut (E)

h3. Expected Results

The page will open on edit mode

h3. Actual Results

The page keeps spinning

h3. Workaround

Let the page load fully and then click on the keyboard page edit shortcut (e).
fields.summary: Page keep spinning when click on keyboard page edit shortcut

fields.description:
{panel:title=Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there's no option to restrict the outgoing connections via [the iframe macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-iframe-macro/].
h3. Suggested Solution

Have a similar function to [Allowlist|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-allowlist-381255821.html] on Confluence DC. It should be safe to allow the domains and IP addresses by default from [Atlassian|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/ip-addresses-and-domains-for-atlassian-cloud-products/]. Otherwise, Confluence should provide an option for the admin to disable the iframe macro.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to configure the iframe allowlist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira roadmap macro displays "missing some required details" error message when the board has complex JQL board filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update JQL board filter to something complex e.g. `project = TEST AND component = EMPTY and created >= 2021-01-01 ORDER BY Rank`.
 # Embed the roadmap on Confluence with "Jira roadmap" macro.

h3. Expected Results

Jira roadmap macro should embed the roadmap view.
h3. Actual Results

Jira roadmap macro displays "missing some required details" error message.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Jira roadmap macro displays error message when the board has complex JQL filter

fields.description: Even if someone is an admin of their own space within our instance, we do not want to allow everyone the ability to turn their space into an anonymous access - enabled space.  Is there a way to control or disable the option of allowing anonymous access in certain or specific spaces within the instance in the global settings?  I couldn't see a way to turn this off.  We need anonymous access for SOME specific spaces, but we don't want other spaces to accidentally (or intentionally) become public spaces through anonymous access, so we want the ability to restrict anonymous access in specific (or all) spaces except those which we designate or approve as okay for anonymous access.
fields.summary: Ability to prevent Confluence Users from turning On / Off Anonymous Access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing a Confluence instance that is restricted with the Ip allow list, sometimes the red "We’ve hit a snag" error message is shown instead of the "There was a problem accessing this content" message.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an allowlist for Confluence, with an IP different than yours
# Try to access Confluence's homepage
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
The following error should always be shown:
{quote}There was a problem accessing this content
Check your network connection and try again, or contact your administrator for help.{quote}
| !Screen Shot 2021-04-12 at 7.15.29 PM.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown sometimes:
{quote}We’ve hit a snag
The issue should resolve on its own, but if it keeps happening, ask your admin to contact our support team and give them:

The URL of this page
The code associated with this error: nfrkoc

Refresh page{quote}
| !Screen Shot 2021-04-12 at 7.23.06 PM.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Clearing the browser's cache will make the right error message to be shown, but reloading the page again might show the "We’ve hit a snag" error
fields.summary: Accessing a Confluence instance restricted with IP allowlisting will throw We’ve hit a snag error intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an anchor to the overview page, nothing happens when you click on the link.

It's working fine on the other pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the overview page of a space and edit it.
 # Add an anchor to the page and name it. (e.g. anchor).
 # Select the link tool.
 # Enter the name of the macro prefaced by a # symbol. (e.g. #anchor)
 # Publish the page.
 # Click on the link.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be taken to the part of the page where the anchor macro was placed.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when clicking on the link.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Anchor macro doesn't work on the overview page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As part of some changes, Microsoft OneDrive for Business macro is being deprecated and the links inserted on the macro will be converted to [Smart Links|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Introducing-Smart-Links-a-richer-way-to-hyperlink/ba-p/1412786].

However, the Smart Links for Microsoft sharepoint links are not working with the embedded option, only shows the Smart Link card on the fabric editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in fabric editor
 # Generate a sharepoint link with the share option (dont try with direct links)
 # Open the macro Microsoft OneDrive for Business and insert the link on the field URL
 # Save the macro
 # Check the behavior on the page

h3. Expected Results
The Smart Link would embed the file, on a similar way it used to work on the Microsoft OneDrive for Business macro.

h3. Actual Results
There is no embedded option for the Smart Links.

h3. Workaround
If there is the legacy editor available on the site, try inserting the macro on the page. This should allow the embedded view of the macro.
fields.summary: Smart Links does not embed files for Microsoft OneDrive/SharePoint Links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to specify a Root page for a space to be displayed in the page tree macro the macro displays and error message as mentioned below:
 !image-2021-04-12-15-50-11-145.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and use a page tree macro on the page.
 # update the space key and the root page which needs to be displayed in the macro

h3. Expected Results

The macro should result the page tree starting from the Root page specified from the space.
h3. Actual Results

It displays an error message.
{quote}The root page KEY:Title could not be found in space [Space Name]
{quote}
h3. Workaround

As a temporary workaround, leave the root page blank and only specify the space which will fetch the page tree of that space in the macro display and the overview page of that space will be the default Root page.
fields.summary: page tree macro fails when specifying a root page

fields.description:
Duplicate avatars are appearing when editing a confluence page in a new tab.

!image-2021-04-11-07-37-09-857.png!
fields.summary: Duplicate avatars appear when editing a confluence page in a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's not possible to embed a particular Google Spreadsheet tab on a Confluence page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Google Spreadsheet and go to a tab that is NOT the first one.
# Copy the URL from Step 1
# Go to Confluence and Paste the URL from Step 2
# The link appears as a smart link and then I click on display as "Display
embed"

h3. Expected Results
The spreadsheet shows the particular tab. 

h3. Actual Results
The spreadsheet displays the 1st tab.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It's not possible to embed a particular Google Spreadsheet tab on a Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For large instances, if the backup is running during a deployment or during node termination (due to a number of reasons), it will fail with DEAD status.

This is an intermittent issue that happens with higher frequency for large instances, such as +200GB.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence instance with 200GB or more, trigger a backup (including attachments);
 # If the backup completes, trigger it in a different hour of the day.

h3. Expected Results

The backup should always succeed;
h3. Actual Results

The backup fails intermittently with DEAD status and no error logs in the backend.
h3. Workaround

Since this issue happens intermittently, triggering it again in a different time of the day usually works.
fields.summary: Large backups may fail with DEAD status

fields.description:
h4. Current Scenario

Currently, the [Add new permission to space REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-space-permissions/#api-api-space-spacekey-permission-post] allow users to manage below permissions through it:
{code:java}
'create': 'page', 'blogpost', 'comment', 'attachment'
'read': 'space'
'delete': 'page', 'blogpost', 'comment', 'attachment'
'export': 'space'
'administer': 'space'
{code}
h4. Suggested Improvement

Admins need the ability to grant additional permissions through the API, such as *Delete Own content,* *Archive Pages* and *Add/Delete Restrictions*. Please, implement such capability on this REST API.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to grant Delete Own, Archive Pages and Add/Delete Restrictions permissions through the REST API

fields.description: Allow the users to stylise their own headers with customised colours, sizes, fonts, etc... Either on Confluence page directly or on the PDF export stylesheet.
fields.summary: PDF Export Stylesheet CSS, allow modification of headers, tables, fonts (size/colour/font type)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Labels gadget in Confluence* and configuring the same to retrieve specific labels from specific Jira projects, the same will only display the content as raw HTML, instead of the Jira content itself.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence page using the *NEW* editor 
 # Add the *Labels Gadget* macro and apply any configuration that will work, or, not identify any labels.
 # Publish the page, or, simply check the result while editing the gadget/macro.

h3. Expected Results

The macro gadget content should be displayed correctly
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2021-04-08 at 2.59.22 PM.png|width=555,height=130!
h3. Workaround

There is not a known workaround for this.
fields.summary: New Editor Labels gadget marco only shows content as raw HTML
Anchor and header links creates static links

fields.description: Please refer to https://atlassian.slack.com/archives/CFGRZK3MF/p1617300508484200
fields.summary: Swap out style sheet to return valid CSS
CDAC post / rollout plan to let existing use cases take note and adapt to changes

fields.description: It would be great to differentiate the page view in the sidebar of the space to differentiate the page view.
fields.summary: It would be great to differentiate pages in the side bar for spaces.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Legacy editor, there was a native feature of creating a link to an attachment. Such functionality is achieved using the Insert Link macro:

!image-2021-04-07-18-50-52-452.png|width=598,height=419!

However, if you use this macro to embed a link to an attachment from another page, and then archive the attachment page + convert the link page to the new editor, the page won't load and throw an error. 

(on) This bug only affects the new editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page (let's call it *Page A*).
 # Add an attachment to this page (let's call it *Attachment A*).
 # Publish *Page A*.
 # Now, create a new page (let's call it *Page B*), using the *Legacy editor*.
 # On *Page B*, use the *Insert Link* macro to create a link on the page to *Attachment A* (which is uploaded on *Page A*).
 # Publish *Page B*.
 # Convert *Page B* to the new editor. 
 # Archive *Page A*.
 # Access *Page B*.

h3. Expected Results

Page B should load as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Page B won't load, and below error will be displayed:

!image-2021-04-07-18-55-14-302.png!
h3. Workaround

Restore Page A, and then you can attach the file directly into Page B if needed.
fields.summary: Converted pages with a link to an attachment that was archived won't load

fields.description: Currently alerts are missing on phase 4 failures. We need to add these alerts so on call is alerted ASAP is something goes wrong.
fields.summary: cc-graphql: Add alerts for phase 4 failures in cc-graphql

fields.description: To enable any FF in project hummingbird please do so by FF approvals
fields.summary: Enable Flag Approvals for hummingbird related FF change.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently when in phase 4 we see error on graphql

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch the primary source flag to phase 4
# Load the comments (footer or inline) form UI

h3. Expected Results
Comments should render just fine 

h3. Actual Results
Error from cc-graphql

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

Splunk error: 
https://splunk.paas-inf.net/en-US/app/search/changegateway?form.time_range.earliest=-24h%40m&form.time_range.latest=now&form.environment=*&form.business_unit=*&form.service=confluence-frontend-next&form.user=*

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: [Project Hummingbird] cc-graphql: Fix phase 4 bug in cc-graphql

fields.description:
The Ask: It would be good to have ability to view spaces in Confluence in a hierarchical Space Tree structure

 

Description:

If there is a wa
y to organize 
the spaces 
in confluence according t
o the Organizational H
oerarchy it would be gr
eat
fields.summary: ability to view spaces in Confluence in a heirarchical Space Tree structure

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Email Notification when a user is mentioned can break when the page body contains some special characters

h3. Steps to reproduce 
(Only happens in TinyMCE)
# Create a Page using the Storage Format below:
 [^table storage format.txt] 
# Mention a user in the _Comments_ column

h3. Expected Result
Email notification received by the mentioned user should include the page body content normally

h3. Actual Result
Error message below is in the email notification
{code}
Error: [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] Unexpected character '<' (code 60) excepted space, or '>' or "/>" at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,327]
{code}
 !email notification.JPG|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Email Notification for User Mention broken when specific characters are in the page body

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The activity stream shows different data – sometimes most recent ones, but most of the time it shows recent activities if we refresh the macro then it shows activities from over a month ago and other old activities.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Go to confluence page, insert an activity stream macro.
 # Step 2 Refresh the page/macro

h3. Expected Results
It should show all recent activities after refreshing the macro.
h3. Actual Results
On every refresh it shows different old and new recent activities and sometimes it shows error.
 !image-2021-04-07-16-43-47-337.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-04-07-16-43-21-711.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Activity stream macro doesn’t display recent activity after refreshing the page/macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customer is unable to list all their decisions items from pages in a space.

Details can be found here https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-642405
h3. Steps to Reproduce
At this stage we can only reproduce on the customers instance
* Customer has a report macro on a page in their space
* Only one page has their decisions coming through on the macro via search
* There is one page missing currently which is not showing up

h3. Expected Results
All decisions on pages in a space should appear in the Decision Report Macro
h3. Actual Results
One page is not displaying correctly with just current space or single label

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Workaround is for the customer to add additional labels to the page that has the decisions.
fields.summary: Decision Report Macro Incorrect Search Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users on tenant `11fbb64d-925d-4eee-8f2f-e04855d7eaa0` does not receive a notification when changes are being made to a page that they watch/subscribe to. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Watch or subscribe to a page
 # Make changes to the page

h3. Expected Results

Should receive email notification regarding the changes. 
h3. Actual Results

No email notification received for the change in the page. 
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users not receiving notification when watching/subscribing to a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Org admins are able to specify the [idle session duration|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/update-idle-session-duration/] for managed accounts. However, if the user leaves the browser open (without interaction), and tries to use Confluence or Jira after the session duration limit, instead of being redirected to an authentication screen, they are still logged in, but can't interact with the app - the pages throws errors, etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the idle duration of a managed account.
 # Access a Space on Confluence, with the managed account (instead, you can access a Jira project).
 # Leave the browser opened without interaction with it, for a longer period than the session duration.
 # Then, tries to access a page in the tree (Confluence), or an Issue on Jira.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be redirected to authenticate.
h3. Actual Results

The user shows as still logged in, but the page throws an error and doesn't load.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page. You'll be prompted to authenticate.
fields.summary: Misleading error messages when interacting with Confluence/Jira after an idle session expired

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Confluence Cloud, it is possible to copy a page, so that you can easily duplicate its content/use an old page as a template to a new one. However, in case the page has some images attached to its body, the editor will load for the copied version, but its images won't load. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on Confluence Cloud.
 # Add some images to the page's body (I guess the amount of images is related with their size/width - I was able to reproduce this with 5 images once, but it is more easily reproduceable with more than 10).
 # Publish the page.
 # Click on the three ellipses > *Copy*.
 # Specify the location for the copied version.
 # Click on *Copy*.

h3. Expected Results

The editor should load with the images being correctly displayed. 
h3. Actual Results

Although the editor loads, the images won't load:

!image-2021-04-06-19-29-31-218.png|width=548,height=239!
h3. Workaround

If you refresh the browser, the images will load.
fields.summary: Images won't load when copying a page with some images

fields.description:
Currently using {{3.0/listApplicationLinks}} does not allow for apps to collect information, be it authorizing with app tokens or AP.requests.

The goal is to expose this endpoint for third-party usage.
fields.summary: Allow for listApplicationLinks endpoint to accept App Tokens or AP.requests
CQL search for custom content fails when using containment relationships

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Certain image dimensions can't be set as favicon

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a PNG image file, with transparent background, sized as 100x100
# Go to {{/wiki/admin/sitelogo/view-sitelogo.action}}
# Upload the image to be set as site logo

h3. Expected Results

Site logo gets updated with the image you've just updated.

h3. Actual Results

Site logo remains the same as before.

The below error is seen on the browser network log

{code}
Request URL: */wiki/admin/sitelogo/uploadFavicon.action
Status: 403
{code}

h3. Workaround

Resize the image to either 72x72 or 128x128
fields.summary: Certain image dimensions can't be set as favicon

fields.description:
We wish to provide a way that allows the site administrators to enable or not the "Request Access" button on restricted pages.

We know that unauthorized users are not able to see restricted pages on the page tree. However, sometimes one of them gets the page URL and tries to access it.

We wish to provide a way to disable the "Request Access" cause sometimes the user' and space admin don't want to receive this request and if the URL somehow starts to being shared with a lot of users in a company this might become annoying and damage the user experience.

The best way would be if this feature would be available on each restricted page so they can be managed individually and might not impact other ones.
fields.summary: Enable/Disable Request Access Button on Restricted Pages

fields.description:
Now when I try to insert action item it gets appended to the page right under the ordered list, not inside of it. 

!image-2021-04-06-17-09-38-644.png|width=227,height=81!

For now,  this is how the Tasks are designed, they're meant to be a "block" item and take up the whole width.

but it should be possible to add an action item inside a list like next to a: in the above screenshot
fields.summary: Unable to create action items inside lists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a page has a big content ID, such as 54844781062652836, it won't be possible to upload files to that page, neither access the exisiting attachments, if any.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a page with id as big as 54844781062652836
 # Try to upload a file

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to upload files to the page

h3. Actual Results
An error is thrown when trying to access/ add attachments to the page.

h3. Workaround
iIt is possible to upload the attachment through the *page menu (...) > attachments*, upload the attachment there, and then go back to the edit mode of the page and insert the file through the files and images button in the toolbar
fields.summary: Can't upload attachments to pages with a long id on the legacy editor
Pagination for the /wiki/rest/api/group/member REST API is broken

fields.description:
When providing a user experience to download an attachment, it's beneficial to show users the size of the attachment so they can determine if they wish to download it. 

This request is to provide an API that apps can use to determine the size of an existing attachment.

This is similar, but different to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-71930.
fields.summary: Attachment metadata API

fields.description:
When providing a user experience to create/upload attachments, it's beneficial to understand what the maximum size of attachments are allowed. 

This request is to provide an API that apps can use to determine the maximum size of attachments allowed for a given tenant (configurable via [https://\|https:]{some-tenant}/secure/admin/ViewAttachmentSettings.jspa). 

This is similar, but different to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-71931.
fields.summary: Attachments metadata API

fields.description:
If I have a Confluence page at `https://confluence.americas.mysite.com/display/SE/Potato+Salad` and someone changes the page title to "Macaroni Salad" any previous bookmark of that page is broken. I can use the "sharing" url, but to bookmark that page I have to go into my bookmark manager (in Chrome at least) and manually edit the bookmark. If I just click the bookmark (star) button in Chrome the bookmark will be broken by anyone who changes the page title. 

 

I am aware that confluence will show the user a page with the most likely new page for that url. This seems more fragile than using a canonical url. 

 
SO does this right:

[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66960510/expo-barcode-scanner-is-deleting-null-characters]

and

[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66960510/ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZexpo-barcode-scanner-is-deleting-null-characters]

go to the same place because the latter part of the url is only there for SEO reasons.
fields.summary: Support canonical URLs for ease of bookmarking

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There is a default limit of 250 inline comments that the backend returns.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a *page* and add more than 250 inline comments (it could be 251, for example);
# Click on any of the comments you added.

h3. Expected Results
It shows the comment you added as "_171 of 251_" comments.

h3. Actual Results
It only shows "_171 of 250_" in the UI.

*Notes*
* The inline comments are created in the backend;
* It happens on either published or draft pages.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Cannot have more than 250 inline comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we login as user/ impersonate user and try editing page restrictions on restricted pages, it doesn’t allow to add new users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a user Test A and login into confluence site.
 # Step 2 Create a page and restrict it with "Only specific people can edit view"
 # Step 3 Login using your site admin user.
 # Step 4 impersonate user Test A, access the restricted page and try editing the page restrictions.

h3. Expected Results
Site admin/space admin should be able to modify, add new user in restrictions.

h3. Actual Results
Site admin/space admin not able to modify, add new user in restrictions.

h3. Workaround

Remove the page restrictions *anyone can edit view this page*
fields.summary: site admin unable to add new user in page restrictions if login as user/impersonate user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It's currently not possible to have an attachment (e.g. PDF file) placed in a bulleted/ numbered list, it will be inserted after/ below the list.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the possibility of adding files inside of lists.

h3. Workaround
Attach the file through *•••* -> *Attachments* and then put its link into the list.
fields.summary: Ability to attach files into a list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the [Confluence Cloud mobile app for iPhone|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/mobile-app], if you're using linking to a question inside a space, the link won't work.

(i) Additional details:
 * Confluence app version: 2.84.0
 * Tested iOS app version: 14.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence Cloud instance, create a page, add text, and [add a link from a Questions for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questions/integrate-questions-with-your-spaces-407724495.html] that resides within a space.
 # Publish the page.
 # With an iPhone, [download the Confluence Cloud app|https://apps.apple.com/app/apple-store/id1006971684] and access the created page.
 # Tap any of those Questions for Confluence links.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be redirected to the page in the link and view the Questions for Confluence post.

h3. Actual Results
An error message appears: “Oops, something went wrong. Please try again later. Page not found. This page may have been removed or you don’t have permission to see it.”, as if the links were broken.

h3. Notes

Links to spaces have the following pattern:

{code}
/wiki/display/<SPACEKEY>/customcontent/list/ac%3Acom.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions%3Aquestion?ac.com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions.path=/questions/<QUESTION_ID>
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is only one known workaround for this issue:
* Open the link on a browser (on Chrome and Safari worked).
* Change the link from:
{code}
/wiki/display/<SPACEKEY>/customcontent/list/ac%3Acom.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions%3Aquestion?ac.com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions.path=/questions/<QUESTION_ID>
{code}

to

{code}
/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions/globalQuestionsViewer?ac.com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions.path=/questions/<QUESTION_ID>
{code}

(That will automatically redirect you to the browser version)
fields.summary: Links for space Questions for Confluence won't redirect on iOS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The security configuration "User email visibility" is not being respected on Confluence cloud. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

As a *Confluence admin*, set the *User email visibility* security configuration to *only visible to site administrators'*

 !config.png|thumbnail! 


As a regular Confluence user, configure the Atlassian account's [profile visibility|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings/] setting and set *Email Address = Anyone* (visible to any user in cloud)

 !profile.png|thumbnail! 

As the regular user above, create a page in the Confluence site

As another Confluence user without site-admin access, inspect the activity logged by the user above. 

h3. Expected Results

Based on the site's User email visibility settings, the email address of the user should not be visible to other users. 

{quote}
https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/configure-user-email-visibility/

*Only visible to site administrators* only Confluence administrators can see the email addresses. Note that, if you select this option, email addresses will not be available in the 'User Search' popup (e.g. when setting Add or Remove Page Restrictions).
{quote}


h3. Actual Results

The email address of the account is listed. 

 !visibility.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "User email visibility" is not working in Confluence cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the [Confluence Cloud mobile app for iPhone|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/mobile-app], by tapping the links for different pages while navigating in a page, the user will not be redirected to the page(s) in question.

(i) Additional details:

* This does not happen with the Android app.
* This only happens with page links added to texts. Smart links (when a page link is simply pasted into a page) will not trigger the issue.
* This does not happen with links to external web pages.
* Confluence app version: 2.4.0
* Tested iOS app version: 14.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence Cloud instance, create a page, add text, and [add a link from another page to the text|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-links-and-anchors/] into a text.
# Publish the page.
# With an iPhone, [download the Confluence Cloud app|https://apps.apple.com/app/apple-store/id1006971684] and access the created page.
# Tap any of the added links.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be redirected to the page in the link.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens, as if the links were pure text.

h3. Workaround
There are a few workarounds for this issue:
* Simply paste the page's URL instead of adding it to a text with the linking function. This will create a smart card. Like the example below, showing the differences of a smart card and a page link added to a text:
!smart_link.png|thumbnail!
* Manually access the page(s) by using the search mechanism of Confluence. 
* If the page(s) were recently accessed, they can be accessed via the *Recent* tab.
fields.summary: Tapping Confluence page links added to text using the iOS app won't work

fields.description:
Currently, if you add an inline-comment to a page you're automatically added as a watcher of that page. 

This can be disruptive for teams that relies heavily in this feature to drop notes but do not necessarily feel the need to be kept up to date with the following responses.
fields.summary: Allow Users to opt-out from being a watcher of a page whenever they're leaving an inline comment in it

fields.description:
Creating a new page in chrome is not as nice as Google docs so often I use Google docs instead of Confluence.

 

It take me 4 clicks to create a new document in confluence and Jira:
 * One click to open a new tab (or keyboard shortcut)
 * One click to click on my shortcut to confluence
 * One click to open a new document

This process takes me 9.09 seconds.

The same process in Google docs take me 1 click / shortcut (cmd + t) and typing "docs.new" then hitting enter. This take me 4.89 seconds. Almost twice as fast.
fields.summary: Confluence.new to create a new confluence page (and same for Jira)

fields.description: Allow an option to comment on content for internal authenticated users that do not consume a user license/ allow comment on Confluence pages shared by public link
fields.summary: Ability to comment on Confluence pages shared by public link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The AP.confluence.getContentProperty has regressed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app that contributes a web panel
 # Visit a page with the web panel active.
 # Open the browser developer tools.
 # Enter AP.confluence.getContentProperty('foo', console.log) and observe the result.

h3. Expected Results

No exception occurs
h3. Actual Results

A DOMException occurs
h3. Workaround

Change calls from AP.confluence.getContentProperty to using AP.request.
fields.summary: AP.confluence.getContentProperty throws a DOMException
CQL search with invalid statement returns bad error response

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[CQL|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/advanced-searching-using-cql/] allows for wildcards like {{cql=text~term*}}. Sometimes one variation of the search term will return results while another does not (might be shorter or longer).
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Searching with this set (Set A):
 cql: text~'Mü*'
 cql: text~'Mün*' 
 cql: text~'Münc*' 
 cql: text~'Münch*' 
 cql: text~'Münche*' 
 cql: text~'München*' 
 cql: text~'München c*' 
 cql: text~'München ca*' 
 cql: text~'München can*' 
 cql: text~'München cand*' 
 cql: text~'München candies to d*' 
 cql: text~'München candies to di*' 
 cql: text~'München candies to die*'

Should produce the same results as these (Set B):
 cql: text~'München candi*' 
 cql: text~'München candie*' 
 cql: text~'München candies*' 
 cql: text~'München candies t*' 
 cql: text~'München candies to*' 
 cql: text~'München candies to die f*' 
 cql: text~'München candies to die fo*' 
 cql: text~'München candies to die for*'
h3. Expected Results

Both Set A and Set B return the same page.
h3. Actual Results

Set A returns the page. Set B returns no results.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: CQL search using a wildcard returns inconsistent results

fields.description:
Heyo,

I work on pages that I'm constantly reviewing and editing, however I end up manipulating the total views metrics on the analytic page.

Could some sort of filter feature be added for this?

Thanks,

Saba
fields.summary: Filter out author view stats on analytics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Page LIKES not working as expected

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to an article you haven't "liked" yet
2. Like the article through the "like" button at the bottom
3. Notice the button changes to "Unlike"
4. Switch to a different article that you've not previously liked
5. Notice the link text still says "Unlike"

h3. Expected Results
It should stay as it is.
 !image-2021-03-31-22-41-31-328.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The like the button changes to *UNLIKE* with 
 !image-2021-03-31-22-41-00-573.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
No workaround at this moment
fields.summary: Page LIKES not working as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

Users are facing issues while using Google Drive For Confluence, they are not able to see their own files and other users can't see as well when using "Google docs" and "Goggle Sheets", this was previously reported on the Bug CONFCLOUD-66811 and apparently is happening again but we are not sure if it is the same root cause.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install [Google Drive For Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
 # Run the "Google Docs" and "Google Sheets' macro while editing a page.
 # insert a link to a file from your google drive
 # Try to click on sing in at the error message and log in with the same account where you obtained the link to the file
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

Display the file on preview and after being published on confluence.
h3. Actual Results

Error messages attached, not even the owner of the published files can see then at the confluence after sign-in with their google drive accounts,
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not able to see Google Drive files at Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user sets a Decisions Report macro to display a set of decisions that contain a long string of text, the first macro column titled Page Title breaks and incorrectly displays the text.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Place multiple Decisions on this page
 # Add text to the decisions (around 20 words or two lines of text should start to display this behavior)
 # Publish the page
 # Create a new page
 # Place the Decisions Report macro
 # Make sure to set it so the decisions created earlier show up
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

Line breaks occur correctly and all content is displayed correctly
h3. Actual Results

Page title column incorrectly breaks and cause text to be incorrectly displayed.

!Screen Shot 2021-03-31 at 09.42.09.png|width=233,height=137!

!Screen Shot 2021-03-31 at 09.42.27.png|width=225,height=299!

 

This behavior is present in both "narrow" and "wide" page formats.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Displaying decisions with long text on the Decisions Report macro breaks the Page title Column on the macro after publishing

fields.description:
h3.  

Confluence content has concepts such as versions (1, 2, 3,...) and status (current, draft), however, there doesn't seem to be a developer guide explaining these concepts. 

For example, the guide should explain how/when to specify the status query parameter on various REST endpoints such as [POST /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/child/attachment|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---attachments/#api-api-content-id-child-attachment-post]. It should also explain the versions number scheme (does version 1 correspond to not yet published?).

Such a guide may have prevented the the creation of the community topic [Attaching a file via RestAPI to a Confluence page draft|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/attaching-a-file-via-restapi-to-a-confluence-page-draft/46609].
fields.summary: Guide required to explain Confluence content lifecycle concepts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There are two ways to trigger the insertion of a macro in a page;- (a) using the + menu and (b) using the slash menu. The two methods lead to slightly different experiences relating to the configuration of the macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a macro in a page using the + menu.
 # Observe if the macro editor is displayed.
 # Insert a macro in a page using the / menu.
 # Observe if the macro editor is displayed.

h3. Expected Results

The observations at steps 2 and 4 are identical.
h3. Actual Results

The observations at steps 2 and 4 are different. The macro editor is automatically displayed at step 2, but not step 4. At step 4, the user must manually click the pencil icon to display the macro editor. Aside from the inconsistency in user experience, some macros may not make any sense without valid configuration and in many cases there is no sensible default configuration.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Inserting a macro in a page can yield inconsistent user experiences

fields.description:
Hello,

I would like to submit a suggestion pertaining to the theme of large lists in the Confluence configuration menu. At my company, when we work with a large list of User Macros for instance, the edit/delete buttons will often be difficult to track for the appropriate item on large screens, as seen here:

 

!image-2021-03-30-12-04-20-359.png|width=595,height=351!

 

A simple CSS styling addition to the *tr* tag:

*tr:nth-of-type(odd){*

        *background-color: rgb(250,250,250)*

*}*

This will create an alternating contrast of theme for ease of editing/deleting the proper respective item. I personally recommend RGB 250!

Here is what the proposed change would look like with rgb(250,250,250):

 

!image-2021-03-30-12-10-49-894.png|width=586,height=334!

 

I appreciate your consideration. I think that the average user would greatly appreciate this change!

 

Sincerely,

Mazin Abubeker

Software Engineer at OneValley
fields.summary: Slight Theme Change for Ease of Viewing in Confluence Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding an Inline Comment automatically adds you as a watcher of a page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that you have the 'Autowatch' setting disabled at your profile
# Go to any page that you're not watching
# Add an inline comment to it
# Check the 'Watcher' icon

h3. Expected Results

You are not added to the watchers list.

h3. Actual Results

You are added to the watchers list.

h3. Workaround

Right after posting a comment, uncheck the 'Watch' icon to not receive further notifications from that page.
fields.summary: Adding an Inline Comment automatically adds you as a watcher of a page

fields.description: Hi! I'd love to see an "add quick note" option for Confluence. Something on the side of the browser, even better a browser plug in?
fields.summary: Add ability to take notes from anywhere in confluence
